entry.title: Black suit with brown cowboy boots | CAN IT BE DONE?
entry.summary: In this article we are going to tell you why it is fine to wear a black suit with brown cowboy boots. We will answer a few other relevant questions as well. Make sure you read it all the way through. The simple answer is…
entry.content:
In this article we are going to tell you why it is fine to wear a black suit with brown cowboy boots. We will answer a few other relevant questions as well. Make sure you read it all the way through.

Can you wear brown cowboy boots with black suit?

The simple answer is yes, you can. However, there are a couple of fashion rules that apply here. They make the difference as to how the brown cowboy boots can be worn with a black suit. So, what are these rules? Let's take a look.

First, the shade of brown makes a huge difference. It is important to choose a darker shade. A lighter shade of brown or a tan boot simply will not work. When selecting the rest of the outfit, keep things on a monochromatic level. Not only will this make your overall look better, it will make the darker brown cowboy boots stand out.

The other rule is, it depends on where you are wearing this combination. Is it a social occasion? A business meeting or a day at the office? An occasion that calls for an elegant appearance? If the answer to any of these questions is yes, you can wear the brown cowboy boots. However, they should be a dressier style.

 

Should you wear a black suit with brown cowboy boots?

The safer bet is to wear black cowboy boots with the black suit. That is why most men choose this combination. However, when the specific style of cowboy boot fits the occasion, a dark brown color looks quite fine. In fact, it is rather dashing.

Something that matters here is if the suit is a solid black, or it has pinstripes on it. If it does, you would be best off wearing a black boot. It can be a stylish cowboy boot though. If you want to be daring though, a freshly-shined dark brown boot would look very spiffy with such a suit.

The material of the suit can also be a factor in determining the color and style of shoes or boots to wear. According to the fashion gurus, a black linen suit would look fabulous with brown cowboy boots.

When should you consider wearing a black suit with brown cowboy boots?

There are many occasions where a black suit with brown cowboy boots are appropriate. Not only for men, but for women wearing a black pants suit for that special occasion. Like when? Keep reading.

This combination can be worn to political events. Over the years, even presidents have done this. Other times you will see people in mariachi bands wearing them. Law enforcement officers tend to sport this look when attending special events. You might think of rangers in western states like Texas.

Fashion trends have come a long way in the past few decades. Whereas it used to be a fashion faux pas to wear a combination like that, today it is widely accepted. Go ahead and wear them.

What color suit goes with brown cowboy boots?

There are more colors than you might think that will look terrific with brown cowboy boots. You can try different shades of blue, darker green colors, beige or tan suits too. How about a nice charcoal gray suit with them? That would look stunning and very manly.

One tip to remember is, the fancier the suit is, both in color and material, the fancier the boots should be. Imagine your cowboy boots in a dark brown snake skin or alligator hide. Don't laugh, we are serious! Not only can you find boots like that, but they'll make you appear sensational.

Another option for the material of your brown cowboy boots is a nice, smooth suede. Oh, how handsome you will be in those. If your suit color is also brown, your boots will enhance your overall appearance.

Is it OK to wear boots with a suit?

As we discussed earlier, nowadays, that is a more hip fashion trend. Decades ago it would have been frowned upon, but today it is fine. Again, it depends on the occasion.

What about a woman wearing boots with her pantsuit? We touched on that briefly too. Basically, it is now acceptable if the circumstances are right. It has to be the right event and the pantsuit is not too formal.

With men or women, they should remember that a snazzy pair of cowboy boots in the right style is just as dressy as a pair of dress shoes. They are probably more comfortable too. So, wear the boots with your suit. You are bound to receive compliments.

Final Thoughts

There is nothing like owning a pair of genuine cowboy boots in brown. For that matter, you can own a couple of them in various materials and styles. Then you will have a pair for any occasion that arises.

You don't even need to live in the west to own fine cowboy boots. If no store sells it locally, get them over the Internet. Just be sure you know your correct size. Your friends will marvel over how nice they look. Your business clients will be impressed too. So, what is stopping you from buying a pair right now?

entry.title: Is vaseline good for cowboy boots? (Explained)
entry.summary: Is vaseline good for cowboy boots Wearing a slick pair of cowboy boots can make you feel great, and if worn appropriately, you’ll gain the approval of others too. Yet, like all things that you wear, those stylish boots will eventually break down. How do…
entry.content:
Is vaseline good for cowboy boots

Wearing a slick pair of cowboy boots can make you feel great, and if worn appropriately, you’ll gain the approval of others too.

Yet, like all things that you wear, those stylish boots will eventually break down.

How do you delay the ravages of time itself? Someone tells you that Vaseline can do the trick…but is that stuff good for boots in general? In this article, we’ll take a look at this product and what it can do for that favorite pair of leather cowboy boots of yours.

Can I use Vaseline on my boots?

Yes you can.

Using a little bit of Vaseline can go a long way. Also known as “petroleum jelly,” Vaseline provides many benefits for just about all leather products.

Seeing how leather is a treated animal skin, Vaseline will react to it similarly to human skin. Some of these benefits include: removing scuffs and scratches, preventing cracking, and providing a bit of cleaning.

How do you treat leather cowboy boots?

Use diligent care.

The process can differ whether you’re treating newer vs. older leather boots of any kind. Cowboy boots are no exception.

As with any leather, your boots will require cleaning after a while.

A simple way to do this is using a nylon brush and a water-based cleaning agent on the outside of your boot. The inside might require a low PH shampoo and careful rinsing.

Should your boots be older, you might have to do a lot more scrubbing depending on the buildup of whatever you gathered on them over the years.

Plus, it’s likely that you also added oil-based protection during that time, which will have to be scrubbed off too.

For newer boots, you might want to consider adding a leather-conditioner to prevent future wear and tear. Specific areas that need this are any part that will experience a lot of flexing while you wear your boots.

For either, it’s recommended that you add a water-based agent to water-proof your footwear. We will discuss that in more detail a bit later.

Will Vaseline ruin leather?

It can if you use it too often.

One source cites “Petroleum Jelly may breakdown the tensile strength of the leather.” Simply put, Vaseline makes the cells within the leather itself swell and expand, causing deformities in your boots.

Seeing as you have to constantly apply it to keep the benefits of using Vaseline in the first place, it’s risky to use this product more than three times a year. In some cases, some boots have been known to “rot” on occasion.

Can you use Vaseline to waterproof leather boots?

You can, but only temporarily.

If the need to waterproof is urgent, Vaseline will help you right away. 

To keep your skin moisturized, it “forms a barrier and prevents water from leaving your skin,” meaning it will have the same effect with leather.

That barrier will also prevent outside water from getting in.

However, this should only be for short-term use. There are better products out there that can water-proof those slick boots without the need for a quick-fix.

What is the best thing to put on leather boots?

Don’t worry, you have options.

As mentioned earlier, if you need a quick-fix regardless, go with Vaseline. If you apply it enough correctly, it will help.

For the longer term, you can use a variety of products that include water-based agents that have no petroleum, such as various waxes and sprays. Also, don’t forget that leather conditioners can help too.

The best you can do for your cowboy boots is keep track of them. Boots are not all that different from anything else people wear on their feet. What your own footwear will go through depends on what you use it for. Are you a rancher? Might want to clean those once every two to three weeks. If you’re using boots as formal wear, maybe not as often.

Also, take a look at your own habits.

Do you dance with them? Do you use them in the mud? Or are they only for indoors? Where you wear them matters too. You don’t have to treat your cowboys like a beloved pet, but give them a good look once in a while. They at least need attention.

Final Thoughts

To recap, keep in mind that Vaseline can water-proof, preserve, and even clean them a bit if you apply it right.

If you need them to last a while, your best bet will be to apply better long-term products.

Regardless of which combination of the above you choose to go, at the very least be consistent in whatever you do. Keep in mind that your cowboy boots are basically pieces of clothing that need cleaning and care.

Some Vaseline may be okay, other times, not so much. If your boots are already deformed, maybe avoid using that stuff.

For cleaning, don’t leave them dirty for too long. Got mounds of muck and dirt? Scrub your boots like you mean it. Not a speck of dust?

Apply a long-term water-based agent. These are only just a few examples. Ultimately, you’ll need to spend time and effort finding the right practice.

entry.title: What are the best jeans to wear with cowboy boots? (Explained)
entry.summary: There are a lot of styles of cowboy jeans available out there. Knowing how to find the right fit to match your cowboy boots is crucial. In fact, your cowboy jeans have evolved so much over the years. This means that choosing what works for…
entry.content:
There are a lot of styles of cowboy jeans available out there. Knowing how to find the right fit to match your cowboy boots is crucial. In fact, your cowboy jeans have evolved so much over the years.

 

This means that choosing what works for you should coincide with fashion trends and style rules. Having a style guide to make it easier for you to choose your best pair of cowboy jeans should be a great thing. Keep reading to find out more about the best jeans to wear with your cowboy boots.

What are the best jeans to wear with cowboy boots?

There are various styles of jeans that are most suitable for cowboy boots.

Denim jeans make the best pair of cowboy boots. Since these boots are an effortless style choice, the following are great options to wear them.

  • Skinny jeans
  • Bootcut jeans
  • Cropped jeans
  • Denim shorts
  • Cowboy cut jeans
  • Straight leg jeans

How should jeans fit with cowboy boots?

Generally, the jeans should be long enough to cover the shaft of your cowboy boots while ensuring that your legs are protected.

Ideally, when you’re choosing your jeans, it's essential to ensure that you find the right fit with great length. These should rest approximately half an inch above the heel of your boots. Additionally, make sure that the jeans aren’t tucked into your boots.

Why is the type of jeans important for cowboy boots?

The main reasons are to provide comfort and protection.

The thing is that cowboy boots are made for walking on unstructured terrain. There is a great deal of debris and other foreign objects that can snag on your jeans. Protecting your legs is important.

 

When to consider choosing the right pair of jeans for cowboy boots?

If you’re going to be working on a ranch or riding horses all day.

The fact of the matter is that cowboys tend to do a lot of heavy lifting. Moreover, you’ll spend most of your time with various animals. The jeans that you choose should be well-fitted, durable, and comfortable.

Who should be paying attention to the type of jeans for their boots?

Cowboys should be paying attention to the type of jeans that they choose to wear for their boots.

However, anyone who spends an adequate amount of time outdoors should also consider the types of jeans that they were. If you spend a lot of time in a ranch, you’ll be exposed to a lot of debris. You should buy durable jeans to protect your boots as well as your legs from dirt.

Where can you go to find the best pair of jeans for some cowboy boots?

In most retail shops.

It’s easy for you to find a great pair of cowboy jeans. The most important thing is for you to have an idea of the type of jeans that you want to buy. You can shop for your cowboy jeans online or you can go directly to a shop near you.

Since you have a wide range of fits and styles to choose from, finding the best pair of cowboy jeans should be relatively easy for you. Even if you’re a beginner.

 How much longer should jeans be for cowboy boots?

Long enough to cover the heels of your boots.

Ideally, the longer your jeans, the better they are. When you’re buying cowboy jeans, going for something longer instead of shorter is a great option. In fact, choosing jeans that are at least a quarter to an inch above your boots is what’s recommended.

Should jeans stack on cowboy boots?

Yes, jeans should stack on your cowboy boots.

It’s recommended that you should have a minor stack in the leg of your cowboy jeans. Especially when you choose to wear them with your cowboy boots. This is why getting the right fit for your jeans is significant. Finding jeans that are the right length that can rest just above your heels is what’s ideal.

Do Cowboys wear their pants over their boots?

Not anymore.

Back in the days there were many cowboys who would tuck their pants inside their boots. This was a way to prevent any dirt from forming at the helm of their jeans. In addition, this was a good way to help prevent their jeans from catching any sticks or snagging on the fence.

But, times have changed and more and more cowboys prefer to wear their pants over their boots. Mainly, this helps to give a slight stack when the cowboy jeans fit well.

Can you wear slim jeans with cowboy boots?

 

Yes, you can.

The thing about cowboy jeans is that they come in different styles. Some people prefer to not stack their jeans. Instead, they choose to tuck in their jeans. Slim or skinny jeans are a better option because they can fit better inside if you want to tuck them inside.

In summary, a lot of thought should go into the type of cowboy jeans that you choose. There are various styles that you can choose from. Moreover, the type of lifestyle that you live should also influence what jeans you wear.

When you’re thinking of cowboy jeans that should go with your cowboy boots, you should also think of the length. Even though people do wear cowboy boots with denim shorts, it’s always a great idea to go for a longer length. This not only plays a vital role in protecting your legs, but it also helps you to have a slight stack that’s fashionably recommended.

entry.title: Do you tuck your pants in cowboy boots? (Explained)
entry.summary: Over the previous few years, fashion trends have altered dressing patterns. These trends are having an increasing impact on our appearance. This essay will go through the style of tucking pants into cowboy boots, why you should do it, what it means, and who should…
entry.content:
Over the previous few years, fashion trends have altered dressing patterns. These trends are having an increasing impact on our appearance. This essay will go through the style of tucking pants into cowboy boots, why you should do it, what it means, and who should do it.

Tucking pants into boots is one of the debatable trends in the fashion world. This debate, however, is not as straightforward as it may appear. 

Do you tuck your pants in cowboy boots?

In my opinion, the genders of individuals greatly influence their decision to tuck in their pants or not. I tuck my pants into my cowboy boots only when necessary.

Females seem more likely to tuck in their boots. Tucked-up pants are more fashionable for females when the pants are skinny and fit snugly in cowboy boots. That said, it is advisable not to tuck in boot cuts. The extra fabric looks out of place and blows about in the wind.

As a male, I rarely tuck my pants into my boots. Males tend to tuck in their pants when needed. Some people feel that males look ridiculous when they wear tuck-up pants purely out of fashion. Functionality plays a tremendous role for males. 

Why should you tuck your pants inside cowboy boots?

 

People tuck their pants in for several reasons, including bug control, cleanliness, and staying trendy. For females, being fashionable may rank high on a list of reasons. Tucked-in pants serve a practical purpose for both men and women.

Pest-control measures:

Bug bites can be a concern depending on where you are. Bugs can crawl underneath the jeans and bite people on their legs if the pants don't get tucked in. This isn't going to be a pleasant experience. Tucked-in pants solve this problem because bugs can't reach the skin of the leg through the openings.

Ensures clean pants:

When people tuck their pants into their boots, they don't care if the bottoms of their pants get filthy. The boots keep the pants from getting soiled, and the wearer is relieved of the burden of washing. People who operate in muddy settings are well aware of the difficulty of washing filthy pants.

Demonstrates your high-end fashion sense:

People sometimes like to brag about how pricey their boots are. Beautiful needlework and boot labels are typically hidden high up and can get hidden if an individual maintains his pants untucked. When individuals purchase well-known designer boots, they will undoubtedly want to flaunt them.

What does it mean when you tuck your pants in your boots?

Tucking pants into cowboy boots entails tucking the pants' lower legs into the boot. This action is done so that the pants do not come undone when the wearer is doing various activities.

The pants should be slim but not very tight. The leg opening of the jeans should be narrow so that it does not come undone. Bootcuts or flared pants should be avoided (in general, but especially for tucking into boots.)

You should wear boots taller than your ankles and have enough room inside for your jeans. The pants can easily slide into the boots with such space.

People that wear their pants tucked into cowboy boots see themselves as confident, rakish, and unconcerned about their surroundings.

Who should be tucking their pants inside of cowboy boots?

Almost everyone can tuck their pants in. For some groups of people, however, it is more common. This wearing style is more prevalent among models and cowboys. Here are a few examples of folks who should tuck their jeans into cowboy boots:

  • Models who desire to keep a fashionable, confident appearance
  • Those who labor outside, particularly in bug-infested locations
  • Cowboys and farmers who operate in a filthy environment.
  • Riders who don't want their pants' loose free ends to catch on the saddle.

Final thoughts

Tucking pants into cowboy boots requires tucking the lower legs of the pants into the boot. Bug control, cleanliness, and being fashionable are among the reasons why people tuck their pants in. Males, like myself, should only tuck their jeans into cowboy boots when necessary. Among many professions, models and cowboys are more likely to dress in this manner.

entry.title: 7 Tips For Wearing A Sports Coat With Jeans And Cowboy Boots
entry.summary: Cowboy boots seem to be a timeless trend. Traditionally worn by cowboys, it is a type of riding boot with a high heel, made from stacked leather, and forms into a pointed toe with a high shaft and no lacing. Cowboy boots are a very…
entry.content:
Cowboy boots seem to be a timeless trend. Traditionally worn by cowboys, it is a type of riding boot with a high heel, made from stacked leather, and forms into a pointed toe with a high shaft and no lacing.

 

Cowboy boots are a very versatile style of shoe that can easily be dressed up by pairing it with a sports coat or blazer or dressed down for a more casual look. These boots can be worn during any season. The boots come in a range of colors that pair well with most outfits.

 

Sports coat with jeans and cowboy boots

Cowboy boots can be paired with jeans and a sports coat provided that the sports coat is made of more textured fabric such as flannel. Both cowboy boots and denim have a casual yet rustic appeal that marries well with a textured sports coat.

 

The idea behind this combination is that the fabrics need to complement each other well and balance each other out in order for the look to work. Most sports jackets or suit jackets come in fine worsted wool fabric which appears more sleek and polished as opposed to casual.

 

In addition, traditional sports coats are more tailored, which is in contrast to the bulky appearance of the boots. Always pair a classic style with quality materials.

 

Can you wear cowboy boots with a blazer?

Pair cowboy boots with a blazer when planning a night out on the town. This is a classic smart-casual look when paired correctly. Dark denim jeans, a solid colored shirt, and a dark blazer look chic and stylish. Keep in mind that the color of the belt should match with the color of the boots.

 

Solid colors have a different appeal when paired together. Combining earth tones for a smart-casual outfit will create a look that is effortlessly chic and stylish.

 

Consider shades such as deep navy, tan, creamy white, white, charcoal gray, deep green, or even black will all pair beautifully with the right shade of cowboy boots. A simple rule is never to pair cowboy boots with a full suit. While this can be done, it leans more toward eccentric rather than chic.

 

Should you wear cowboy boots with a sports coat?

Cowboy boots can and should be worn with a sports coat. The sports coat should be made of textured material to balance out the outfit. The coat should also be tailored and fitted. It should not sit too loose or too tight. The correct fit for the coat is just below the rear.

 

Ideally, polished, plain boots work best for this attire. In addition, an oxford cloth button-down collar shirt complements the attire well. As previously mentioned, the color of the boots and belt should match.

 

Furthermore, be cognizant of the fact that certain colors do not pair well together, such as black and brown. Brown can be paired with both cooler and warmer tones, such as navy blue, gray, white, or tan, while black pairs with most colors on the color palette, including charcoal gray, white, tan, burgundy, or even navy blue.

 

When should you consider wearing boots with a sports coat?

Wear boots with a sports coat for any event that calls for smart casual attire. Sports coats are generally more casual than blazers. The smart casual dress code is a balance between casual wear and more formal attire. Pair boots with a sports coat for a business casual or smart-casual event. This pairing is ideal for social occasions that have a professional flare.

 

Cowboy boots are rustic and casual, while a sports coat leans more towards smart casual. The great thing about textured material sports coats is the variety of patterns and materials that these coats come in.

 

From textured material such as flannel, corduroy, velvet, or wool to different patterns such as herringbone, plaid, windowpane, tartan, etc. there are endless possibilities of combinations that will work very well together.

 

How do you wear a sport coat with jeans?

There is a technique to make this combination work well. Firstly, both the denim and the coat should be fitted. Secondly, the denim should be more formal, such as dark blue denim, while the coat should be more casual. Thirdly, the two items should not be identical in color but the materials should complement each other well.

 

It's so easy to get this paring wrong. All too often, the outfit may sit entirely too loose, the combination of denim and coat look too similar in color and texture, or the denim is too casual for the coat.

 

The best denim for this outfit should be well-fitted, clear, and dark. For the coat, steer clear of blazers that are smooth in material and appear more formal. You may want to opt for a more rustic and casual coat.

 

What is the best sport coat to wear with jeans?

A casual sports coat made from thicker material is ideal to wear with denim. The color of the coat should contrast with the color of the denim and should preferably have two buttons as opposed to three. It should be fitted with unstructured and softened shoulders.

 

Ideally, steer clear of monochromatic colors when pairing a sports coat with denim. There should be a stark color contrast between the two items of clothing.

 

Furthermore, the material of the sports coat should be textured and casual.

 

Final thoughts

There are some simple and basic rules when wearing cowboy boots with a sports coat or blazer. The shoes are more casual, therefore the jacket should match the style of the shoe. This can be achieved through the type of material and/or pattern on the coat/blazer/jacket, and other features such as the number of buttons, shoulder design, and the fit of the coat/blazer/jacket.

entry.title: Do pants go over or under cowboy boots? (Explained)
entry.summary: Do pants go over or under cowboy boots? Both, but it depends on the situation. This also depends on whether you’re a guy or gal. Gals want to show off their boots to friends and peers, so it’s more appropriate to prominently display their cowgirl…
entry.content:
Do pants go over or under cowboy boots?

Both, but it depends on the situation.

This also depends on whether you’re a guy or gal. Gals want to show off their boots to friends and peers, so it’s more appropriate to prominently display their cowgirl boots in public. Doing so is easier as opposed to guys doing the same things, as gals can opt out of jeans for a nice-looking dress.

For guys, it’s more appropriate to wear jeans on the outside of their cowboy boots. The reason being is that the pant legs don’t become too crinkled overtime.

How do you hide cowboy boots under jeans?

It depends on the jeans.

If you wish to hide your stylish cowboy boots for any reason, focus on the kinds of jeans you wear with them. A common type to consider is boot-cut jeans. These are typically 17 to 20 inches long at the leg openings, and are able to hide your boots from sticking out too much. Just as the name of them suggests, boot-cut jeans are made for wearing cowboy boots!

If you can’t find a pair, don’t worry, there’s still a few options you can try. These include using jeans that are fairly long, and ensuring the color is the same (or at the very least, similar) as your cowboy boots. Extra length can also make the overall look more rugged in nature, which most guys love!

For gals, skinny jeans can work too. As these kinds are thin, you can simply wear boots over them. If you want to keep jeans on the outside for any reason, it’s better to find boots that are thin as well, as thick openings on the boots will make your jeans look puffed out and strange.

Most cowboy boots are made to be long, so any jeans you pick to match with them can work just as long as they’re not too short or too thin. This process can be a bit tricky, so give your shoe width size a good look, or ask a boot store employee to measure your size using a guiding chart.

Do you tuck your pants in your cowboy boots?

Unless you’re doing dirty work, then no.

If you plan on going out to show others your western-style, then avoid tucking your pants into your cowboy boots. Formal occasions are intended for people to dress their best. Tucking in your jeans will create unsightly folds and creases that everyone will see. Unless you’re horse-riding or doing muddy work out on a ranch, keep your jeans on the outside.

With that being said, an exception is for the gals with skinny jeans. As mentioned earlier, some boots look better with the jeans tucked in.

Why would you tuck your jeans underneath your boots?

You’d do so for dirty work or for style.

When doing work out on a farm or ranch, it’s a good idea to tuck your jeans into your cowboy boots. Doing so will prevent mud, dirt, and other nasty things from staining your clothes.

This is especially important for those that ride horses a lot. When riding, water and mud puddles will be a constant threat, and tucking in your jeans will prevent them from getting wet and dirty. It’s also recommended to get narrow-cut “Western jeans” paired with “roper” boots, as both of these items are better designed for the outdoors.

Again, sometimes cowboy boots are too wide to fit underneath your pant legs, so tucking them in may be necessary. Check yourself in the mirror before heading out though.

Why would you leave your jeans over your boots?

For style!

Itching to try out your new cowboy boots at a local fair? Wear your jeans on the outside! Doing so may not show off your full western-prowess, but it will look nicer overall. In fact, most men are expected to wear their jeans over boots in most formal gatherings.

However, if there’s a lot of rain and mud at the event, then most (if not all) people won’t bat an eye if you decide to tuck your jeans in.

Gals can wear jeans overtop too, just as long as it looks stylish to themselves and their peers. If possible, for either gender, use a pair of jeans that are just wide enough at the bottom so the boots don’t puff out the pant legs too much.

How do you wear pants with cowboy boots?

Just about any way you want!

There’s no straight answer to this question. Just wear them in a way that’s comfortable, and doesn’t look too weird. Some might prefer to wear the tightest jeans you can imagine and pair them with the widest boots on the market, and others might choose boot-cut jeans with their toes barely sticking out.

However, for those that want to tuck in their jeans without sacrificing style, there’s a smart technique you can use. To get a step by step picture guide, check how to tuck jeans into cowboy boots. If you do it right, you’re ready for just about any public outing!

Final Thoughts

Whether you’re a hardcore rancher, or just a simple cowgirl ready to have a fun night on the town, there are several methods you can use to make your jeans and cowboy boot experience worthwhile. Remember that both style and function matter.

entry.title: Can you wear a fedora with cowboy boots? (Explained)
entry.summary: Can you wear a fedora with cowboy boots? The short and most direct answer to the question of whether someone can or can not wear a fedora with cowboy boots is simply put, yes. There is nothing about the act or decision of wearing a…
entry.content:
Can you wear a fedora with cowboy boots?

The short and most direct answer to the question of whether someone can or can not wear a fedora with cowboy boots is simply put, yes. There is nothing about the act or decision of wearing a fedora on your head and cowboy boots on your feet that necessarily defies the laws of physics or is otherwise regarded as unfeasible within the scientific community. It is completely within the realm of realistic possibilities as well as human abilities.

 

Should you wear a fedora with cowboy boots?

In the case of whether someone should stylistically entertain the idea of combining a fedora and cowboy boots in the same outfit, it all depends on intention.

While the short answer to this question may be no, that sounds insane and is deeply conflicting in terms of intention, let’s indulge ourselves if only for a moment in time, into the circumstances that would permit such a style choice.

Let’s say you are at the airport, on your way to a sunny Cancun vacation, you have on your fedora and sunglasses and are ready for a good time in the sun. Unfortunately, at the airport check-in, it appears you have overpacked your suitcase by roughly three pounds.

Instead of shelling out between $100-$200 for the outrageous overweight baggage fee, you for a second entertain the idea of kicking off those beach-ready flip flops, or super comfortable airport slides, and instead, throw on your ready to party cowboy boots. If this is the case, then sure.

Wearing the combination of a fedora and cowboy boots is not only a fine money-saving device, but certainly, a conversation starter and story rolled into one.

Let’s say it’s Halloween, and you are going for one of those conceptual costume ideas such as “a walking contradiction” or “under compensating for something” or going for comedic relief to break the ice, like “the washing machine shrunk my ten-gallon hat and left me with a fedora” then yes, this will surely garner at least a few chuckles and put you in the good graces of those light-hearted spirits at the party.

The important thing, however, is to keep in mind that you have now committed to the character of the absurd, never forget your gimmick, and you are going to look very strange to a lot of people you have not had the chance to meet.

This can be great because, now to not appear crazy, you must meet as many people as possible. The trick here, however, is now you must stay in the absurdity of this character you have created for the entirety of the night.

Other than the two scenarios outlined above, men who want to be taken seriously by their peers should not wear fedoras with cowboy boots.

Do cowboys wear fedoras?

Not unless they are also undercover cops, infiltrating deep within the hive of outlaw drug traffickers in South Beach Miami, Florida, playing cards and smoking Cuban cigars while awaiting shipments to arrive at the fishing port.

But even then, it’s risky, because the combination of fedora and farmer’s tan alone would surely come across as wildly suspicious to the rest of the crew.

Or, perhaps, let’s say they are on vacation with their families on the outer banks, down along the palm trees lining the eastern coast of the Carolinas, and their wife got it for them as a part of some sort of surprise present package week-long get away from the farm, and now they are stuck wearing it just out of pure love of their wife and family and pure avoidance of conflict and unadulterated fear of altercation during an otherwise relaxing time.

What should men not wear with cowboy boots?

Anything outside the realm of jeans and flannel should be avoided when wearing cowboy boots, but it’s all up to preference after the point of commitment to something such as wearing cowboy boots while not doing cowboy activities or actively working on a farm.

Anything that has not been seen in a country-western music video, movie, at a rodeo, or is local to the midwestern to the southern United States, should typically be avoided in combination with cowboy boots. This includes things like bathing suits, shorts, athletic attire, comfort wear such as sweatpants and sweatshirts.

What do you wear a fedora with?

One of the most important things to wear with a fedora is an attitude. You must commit to the fact you have something between a children’s cowboy hat and a visor sitting atop your head.

This unique combination requires a fun personality who is down for anything. You must be ready to adopt this attitude and hold on to it tightly for the duration of the time the fedora is atop your head.

Some things that are frequently put in combination with a fedora are Hawaiian shirts, shorts, sunglasses, flip flops, swimming trunks, and the occasional suit if you are going salsa dancing. The most important thing is to make sure your clothing is light and airy to let in all the fun you are about to be having.

Final Thoughts

Ultimately, the decision to wear a fedora with cowboy boots comes down to intention, personality, and attitude. However, for most of the population, this stylistic choice and combination should mostly be avoided.

entry.title: How to get a stuck cowboy boot off? (Explained)
entry.summary: How to get a stuck cowboy boot off If you are wondering how to get a stuck cowboy boot off of your leg, then you have come to the right place. This can be one of the most frustrating and uncomfortable things when it comes…
entry.content:
How to get a stuck cowboy boot off

If you are wondering how to get a stuck cowboy boot off of your leg, then you have come to the right place. This can be one of the most frustrating and uncomfortable things when it comes to putting clothes on.

The reason is because the leather usually when you first get your pair of boots, is very stiff and is not comfortable at all to put your feet in and out of. In order to get your a cowboy boots off your foot and leg, you’ll want to grab the heel of the boot and probably slide it down word while arch in your foot upwards or downwards.

You should noticed that as you do that, the boot will begin to properly slight off and your heel will slide upward allowing you to shuttle your entire foot and leg out of the boot.

Again, this is not that fun to do, but as you start to wear them a lot more often, then you should notice that the weather actually starts to break in and the boots are not that hard to wear anymore. Let’s take a quick look though, at whether or not they are supposed to be this hard to takeoff.

Are cowboy boots supposed to be hard to take off?

In general, whenever you purchase a new pair of leather cowboy boots, you should always expect them to be rather stiff and hard to slide on and off. 

The leather is basically brand new, and it needs to be weathered down somewhat in order for it to become more malleable. By wearing your boots out and around town, you should notice that eventually, they will become a lot more comfortable to wear in general, and you are able to put them on and off with ease.

Just keep on wearing them and eventually he will love to wear cowboy boots everywhere you go. Then only that, they can be rather stylish depending on which ones you get. Let’s take a quick look again at how you get these tight little boots off your feet.

How do you get tight boots off?

In order to properly get tight boots off, you’ll want to grab the heel, and promptly pull it away from your actual heel in a downward motion.

As you do this, curl your feet downward, exposing your actual heel in an upward position that is opposite to the direction you are pulling the boot.

You will notice that the hill actually starts to slide away from you, allowing you to escape your foot.

If you don’t want to do this manually yourself, then you can use a little tool that we will talk about in the next section of this article.

 

Here's a youtube video showcasing how to take boots off:

What do you call the thing that helps you take boots off?

The thing that helps you take boots off is known as a cowboy boot jack. 

You basically just slide it down the shaft of the boot until it hits the bottom of the boot heel next to your actual heel. 

This allows you to manually pry open the shaft of the boot to allow your leg and foot to escape the leather. It’s quite effective, it is something you should consider as you start to wear your brand new pair of boots all around town. 

It really is not that comfortable the feeling having very tight boots, but just rest assured that as you start to wear them everywhere, you’ll notice that they start to soften up on you.

How can I soften my cowboy boots?

If you want to really try and soften up your boots, I recommend only doing so naturally. The best way to naturally soften your cowboy boots is to put them on and where them basically wherever you go.

This will allow the leather to begin weathering down, obtaining some moisture, and overtime slowly forming to your profile of your foot and leg. You can manually try to stretch your boots, but that is not recommended since you may be doing more harm than good by overstretching them and possibly tearing the leather.

Final Thoughts

Getting cowboy boots off your foot can be an uncomfortable task, especially if they are tight and not that pleasant to wear. In order to properly get them off just grab heel and put away from your actual heel while arching your foot either upwards or downwards to let the boot slowly slide off. You can use a cowboy boot jack in order to expedite this process.

entry.title: How to keep cowboy boots from rubbing leg? (Explained!)
entry.summary: How to keep cowboy boots from rubbing leg? If you're wondering how to keep your cowboy boots from rubbing against your leg, then you've come to the right place. Having your leg be rubbed raw from some leather cowboy boots is no fun. In order…
entry.content:
How to keep cowboy boots from rubbing leg?

If you're wondering how to keep your cowboy boots from rubbing against your leg, then you've come to the right place. Having your leg be rubbed raw from some leather cowboy boots is no fun. In order to prevent this from happenind, you'll have to wear very long socks that go all the way up to your knees, and give the boots ample time to break in. 

Over the course of several wearing sessions, you should start to notice that your boots will start to become a lot more comfortable and tolerable as you walk around.

Speaking of breaking in cowboy boots, let's take a quick look at how to do that really fast so you can stop them from rubbing against your leg!

How do you break in cowboy boots fast?

Let's talk about how to break in cowboy boots fast and effectively. The simple solution is frankly to start wearing them all over the place. Wearing cowboy boots is the most natural way of letting them quickly form to the size of your feet and calves. 

The leather material that cowboy boots are made from is initially quite stiff, but over time it becomes soft and maleable. This means that as you make it a habit of just wearing them all around town, they will very quickly start to loosen up quite a bit 

Having cowboy boots loosen up on you will feel great, and certainly protect your legs from the constant irritation of having the leather hit your extremeties.

Now that we've briefly covered how you can quickly break in your boots to properly adjust to your leg, let's take a quick look as to why your boots may be hard to fit into intitially. 

Why do some cowboy boots rub against your leg?

If you're wondering why some cowboy boots may be rubbing against your leg, the reasoning is quite simple. It's just that as you purchase a new pair, they are essentially made of a stiff type of leather that takes a lot of conditioning by wearing them around all over.

This means that the leather is very hard to fit even your feet into them at least at first glance, but over time the leather will start to obtain moisture and overall wear to them that will make them very easy to stretch.

Speaking of stretching you boots out, let's answer the qeustion as to how you can go about doing so.

How can I stretch the calf of my cowboy boots?

In order to properly break in and stretch out the calf of your cowboy boots, simply try wearing them everywhere you go. This may seem obvious, but is the most natural way of letting them properly form to your particular size and shape of legs and feet. 

There are probably some aftermarket and manual ways of trying to stretch out the leather of your boots, but you run the risk of either over stretching or even ripping your boots apart.

Always go the natural route!

Final thoughts

If you're tired of having your cowboy boots rubbing against your leg, then have no fear.

One of the most simple fixes to this issue is simply just wear them practically everywhere you go. This is the most natural and efficient way of letting them form to your individual profile.

entry.title: Is Boerne lake open to the public? (Explained)
entry.summary: Boerne lake is open to the general citizens of Boerne, Tx. Due to the influx of people flocking to Texas, Boerne Lake admins usually will make you present your Texas Drivers License to verify you are indeed a Boerne Resident. If you don’t happen…
entry.content:
Is Boerne lake open to the public

Boerne lake is open to the general citizens of Boerne, Tx. Due to the influx of people flocking to Texas, Boerne Lake admins usually will make you present your Texas Drivers License to verify you are indeed a Boerne Resident.

If you don’t happen to have a state drivers license that depicts you living in Boerne, you may not be allowed in. This is to preserve the authenticity and integrity of the lake, and prevent over crowding from people living in San Antonio coming up to enjoy some water activities.

Can I swim at Boerne Lake?

Boerne lake is open to all residents of Boerne, and allows people visiting to enjoy non motorized activities out on the water. The reason why no motorized activities are allowed, is because the lake serves as a reservoir  for domestic purposes of the City of Boerne. Having a lake dedicated for domestic purposes indicates that it is a protected area that needs to have as little contaminates as possible.

Despite not being able to have any motorized activity out on the lake, feel free to bring your paddle boards, kayaks, and other tubing devices and enjoy wading out on the lake in the middle of the Texas Hill Country!

Are there alligators in Boerne City Lake?

There are no known native species of alligators in Boerne City Lake. Despite this, there apparently have been reported sightings and catchings of some alligators that some suspect were dumped in nearby riverbeds.

For the most part, there are no gators present in Boerne lake, or any other lake within the central Texas region of Texas. If you want to find gators, head on over to east Texas, where it is known that gators are native.

What kind of fish are in Boerne Lake?

There are a variety of species of fish at Boerne lake, including:

  • Bass
  • Catfish
  • Sunfish

Here’s a link for more information:

https://tpwd.texas.gov/fishboat/fish/action/waterecords.php?WB_code=0092

Where is Boerne Lake located?

Boerne Lake is located on the northwest side of Boerne, right across from I-10. If you’re driving from Main Street, it’s only about a 5 Minute drive. 

When you’re driving on over to the lake, don’t forget to enjoy the scenery of the area, since that’s where a lot of the hills are. If you drive past the Boerne Lake entrance, you’ll be on this little two lane road that takes you deep into the Texas hill country, and can make for some epic views.
